# Tailwind CSS Dark Mode Guide ## Overview Tailwind CSS provides built-in dark mode support through the `dark` variant. According to the documentation, "dark mode is a first-class feature of many operating systems," and Tailwind makes implementing it straightforward. ## Default Strategy: Media Query By default, dark mode uses the `prefers-color-scheme` CSS media feature. This means dark styles automatically apply when users have enabled dark mode in their operating system settings. ## Class-Based Toggle Strategy You can override the default behavior to use a CSS class instead. The configuration uses a custom variant: ```css @import "tailwindcss"; @custom-variant dark (&:where(.dark, .dark *)); ``` With this setup, add the `dark` class to your HTML element to activate dark styling: ```html
``` ## Data Attribute Alternative You can also use data attributes instead of classes: ```css @custom-variant dark (&:where([data-theme=dark], [data-theme=dark] *)); ``` Then set the attribute on your HTML: ```html ``` ## System Theme Support For three-way toggles supporting light, dark, and system preferences, use JavaScript with `window.matchMedia()` to detect system settings and manage the `dark` class dynamically while respecting localStorage preferences. ## Using Dark Variants Apply dark-specific styles with the `dark:` prefix: ```html
Content styled for both light and dark modes
```

content.text:
Perfect! I've identified the issue. Here's what's happening:

## **Root Cause: Mismatch between dark mode strategies**

**The Problem:**

1. **Tailwind CSS 4.x default behavior**: By default, Tailwind 4 uses `prefers-color-scheme` media query for dark mode (system preference-based)

2. **Your design system**: Uses `[data-theme="dark"]` attribute selector (lines 302-355 in design-system.css)

3. **Landing page HTML**: Uses Tailwind's `dark:` utility classes (line 22 in index.astro: `class="antialiased bg-white dark:bg-gray-950 text-gray-900 dark:text-gray-100"`)

**The Issue:**
- Your Tailwind `dark:` classes respond to system `prefers-color-scheme` 
- Your custom CSS variables respond to `[data-theme="dark"]` attribute
- There's no `data-theme` attribute on your `<html>` element
- There's no JavaScript to toggle between light/dark modes

**Result:** The `dark:` classes in Tailwind work with system preferences, but you probably don't have a theme toggle, and your custom design system tokens never activate because the `data-theme` attribute is never set.

content.text:
## **Found it! Here's how Socialaize does it:**

**Key findings from ~/socialaize:**

1. **global.css (line 5)**: Uses `@custom-variant dark (&:where([data-theme=dark], [data-theme=dark] *));`
2. **Navbar.vue (lines 197-217)**: Has a `toggleTheme()` function that:
   - Sets `data-theme` attribute on `document.documentElement`
   - Stores theme in localStorage
   - Dispatches custom event for other components

**Your project is missing:**

1. ❌ The `@custom-variant dark` in global.css (you have Tailwind v4 but not the custom variant)
2. ❌ JavaScript to set the initial `data-theme` attribute on `<html>`
3. ❌ Theme toggle functionality

**Solution:**

I'll add the `@custom-variant` to make `dark:` classes work with `[data-theme="dark"]`, then you can choose whether to add a theme toggle or just set it to dark by default.

<!doctype html>
<html lang="en">
  <head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8" />
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" />
    <meta name="generator" content={Astro.generator} />
    <meta name="description" content="Automate your social media management with AI-powered tools. Save 10+ hours per week with Socialaize." />
    <title>Socialaize - Automate Your Social Media Management</title>
    <link rel="icon" type="image/svg+xml" href="/favicon.svg" />
    <script is:inline>
      // Initialize theme from localStorage or system preference
      (function() {
        const stored = localStorage.getItem('theme');
        const prefersDark = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)').matches;
        const theme = stored || (prefersDark ? 'dark' : 'light');
        document.documentElement.setAttribute('data-theme', theme);
      })();
    </script>
  </head>

      // Initialize theme from localStorage or system preference
      (function() {
        const stored = localStorage.getItem('theme');
        const prefersDark = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)').matches;
        const theme = stored || (prefersDark ? 'dark' : 'light');
        document.documentElement.setAttribute('data-theme', theme);
      })();
    </script>

content.text:
Perfect! ✅ **Dark mode is now fixed!**

## What I changed:

1. **global.css:3-4** - Added `@custom-variant dark` to configure Tailwind's `dark:` prefix to work with `[data-theme="dark"]` attribute (same pattern as Socialaize)

2. **index.astro:21-29** - Added inline script in `<head>` that:
   - Runs before page renders (prevents flash)
   - Checks localStorage for saved theme preference
   - Falls back to system preference (`prefers-color-scheme`)
   - Sets `data-theme` attribute on `<html>` element

## How it works now:

- Your `dark:` Tailwind classes (like `dark:bg-gray-950`) now respond to `[data-theme="dark"]`
- Your design-system.css custom variables also use `[data-theme="dark"]` (lines 302-355)
- Everything is aligned! 🎉

## Test it:

Open browser console and run:
```js
// Switch to dark
document.documentElement.setAttribute('data-theme', 'dark')

// Switch to light
document.documentElement.setAttribute('data-theme', 'light')
```

Background should change immediately! If you want a toggle button like Socialaize has, let me know and I'll create one.

Perfect! I've enhanced the `DesignSystemShowcase.vue` component with comprehensive testing and documentation. Here's what I added:

## **Summary of Enhancements:**

### **1. Testing Guide Box (Top of page)**
- How to toggle theme (sun/moon button)
- Responsive breakpoints (mobile < 640px, tablet 640-1024px, desktop > 1024px)
- Color contrast verification
- Shadow depth differences in dark mode
- Keyboard navigation testing

### **2. Section-Specific Documentation:**

**Color Palette:**
- 🌓 Dark mode: Explains ring opacity changes (10% light → white/10% dark)
- 📱 Responsive: 5 columns mobile → 11 columns md+

**Typography:**
- 🌓 Dark mode: Text color inversions (gray-900 → gray-100, etc.)
- Background switching (white → gray-900)

**Shadows:**
- 🌓 Dark mode: References design-system.css lines 318-323 for increased opacity
- Card backgrounds: white → gray-800
- 📱 Responsive: 2 columns mobile → 5 columns md+

**Components:**
- 🌓 Dark mode: Auto-adjusting backgrounds, borders, text
- Hover states remain functional
- 📱 flex-wrap ensures mobile stacking

**Cards:**
- 📱 Stacks vertically mobile → 3 columns md+
- Hover: shadow-sm → shadow-md

**Glassmorphism:**
- 🌓 Dark mode: rgba(255,255,255) → rgba(17,24,39)
- References design-system.css:538-560
- 📱 Mobile blur performance testing note

**Connection Indicators:**
- 🌓 Dark mode: Background/text color inversions
- References design-system.css:857-873

**Gradients:**
- 🌓 Dark mode: Complete gradient transformations
- References design-system.css:330-354
- 📱 1 column mobile → 2 columns md+

**Accessibility:**
- ✅ Tab key for keyboard navigation
- Screen reader testing for .sr-only
- OS-level "Reduce motion" testing

## **Your theme toggle is now working!** 

Test it by:
1. Visit http://localhost:4323
2. Click the sun/moon button in the top-right (from ThemeToggle.vue)
3. Watch everything respond to light/dark mode changes
4. Resize browser to test responsive breakpoints

content.text:
Looking at line 123 in AdvancedFeaturesSection.vue, I found the issue:

```vue
<section class="py-20 px-4 sm:px-6 lg:px-8 bg-gradient-to-b from-white to-primary-50 dark:from-white dark:to-primary-950/20">
```

**The Problem:**
The dark mode gradient is **broken** - it goes `from-white` which is incorrect for dark mode. It should go from a dark color, not white!

**Current (BROKEN):**
- Light: `from-white to-primary-50` ✅ Correct
- Dark: `from-white to-primary-950/20` ❌ **WRONG** - still starts from white!

**Expected:**
- Light: `from-white to-primary-50`
- Dark: `from-gray-950 to-primary-950/20` or `from-gray-900 to-gray-950`

Let me check the rest of the file for similar issues:

input.description: Find incorrect dark mode white backgrounds

content.content: 123:  <section class="py-20 px-4 sm:px-6 lg:px-8 bg-gradient-to-b from-white to-primary-50 dark:from-white dark:to-primary-950/20">

toolUseResult.stdout: 123:  <section class="py-20 px-4 sm:px-6 lg:px-8 bg-gradient-to-b from-white to-primary-50 dark:from-white dark:to-primary-950/20">

content.text:
Perfect, only one instance. Now let me propose the solution:

## **Problem Analysis:**

**Line 123:** The section background gradient incorrectly uses `dark:from-white` which means in dark mode, the gradient still starts from white instead of a dark color. This creates a jarring white flash at the top of the section in dark mode.

**Root Cause:** The dark mode variant only changed the `to-` color but forgot to change the `from-` color.

## **Proposed Solutions:**

### **Option 1: Match design-system.css gradient patterns (Recommended)**
Use the gradient variables from design-system.css for consistency:

```vue
<section class="py-20 px-4 sm:px-6 lg:px-8" style="background: var(--gradient-hero-subtle)">
```

### **Option 2: Fix the Tailwind classes**
Change the dark mode gradient to start from a dark color:

```vue
<section class="py-20 px-4 sm:px-6 lg:px-8 bg-gradient-to-b from-white to-primary-50 dark:from-gray-950 dark:to-primary-950/20">
```

### **Option 3: Use transparent overlay approach**
Keep background simple and consistent:

```vue
<section class="py-20 px-4 sm:px-6 lg:px-8 bg-gray-50 dark:bg-gray-950">
```

**I recommend Option 2** as it:
- ✅ Fixes the dark mode issue
- ✅ Maintains the gradient aesthetic
- ✅ Uses Tailwind utilities (easier to understand)
- ✅ Follows the existing pattern in the codebase

Shall I implement Option 2?

content.text:
Perfect! ✅ **Dark theme background issue fixed!**

## **What was changed:**

**File:** `/Users/natedamstra/test-code/ui-design/src/components/AdvancedFeaturesSection.vue`

**Line 123 - BEFORE:**
```vue
bg-gradient-to-b from-white to-primary-50 dark:from-white dark:to-primary-950/20
```

**Line 123 - AFTER:**
```vue
bg-gradient-to-b from-white to-primary-50 dark:from-gray-950 dark:to-primary-950/20
```

## **The Fix:**

Changed `dark:from-white` → `dark:from-gray-950`

**Now the gradient behaves correctly:**
- **Light mode:** White → Light primary teal (`from-white to-primary-50`) ✅
- **Dark mode:** Dark gray → Dark primary teal (`dark:from-gray-950 dark:to-primary-950/20`) ✅

The section will now properly transition from a dark background in dark mode instead of flashing white at the top. You can test this by toggling the theme button in your browser at http://localhost:4323!
